III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

• No technical assistance was requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• When organizing youth's files considering placing discharge documents at the
beginning of the file and all the licensing information is contained within the
discharge summary rather than in different locations.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, which was for the renewal inspection, and compliance with each
individual CAP is as follows: The CAP for the 2023 Renewal Inspection was
completed as outlined. Documentation indicates 3rd shift staff were retrained on
room checks and a quiz was provided at the end of the training. Daily checks of the
room logs were completed as outlined. This involved daily reviews for the first
month and moving to random checks during the second month (at least 3 times a
week). In the third month weekly checks occured and administration reviewed the
findings weekly. This action appears to have been successful since no issues were
found during this inspection.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator's Assessment addressed the CAP put into place to
address bedroom checks found during the Renewal inspection for 2023. The
program manager and assistant managers established a system to check the data
of the bedroom checks beginning with multiple times a week moving towards
random weekly checks. It is also noted that the facility is on track with their KPIs,
and no issues have been noted. Finally, the policies and procedures were reviewed
in November 2023 and no significant changes were made.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed were very positive and all reported they enjoy working at the
facility. They reported administration is very supportive and provides the
appropriate training and support for them to complete their tasks. They did not
report any issues they are concerned with at this time.
3

Only two of the five youth in the program have the ability to communicate (very
limited) verbally. However, both appear very happy and did not report any
concerns. Interactions between staff and youth was observed and staff were highly
engaged with the youth and following the treatment plans outlined by the therapist.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is a single-story building that is maintained appropriately. All bedroom
as furnished appropriately, and the living area has adequate furnishing. All required
items are posted and items requiring to be locked up were. The medications are
stored appropriately, and the medication logbooks are being completed as
required. Bedroom checks are being completed appropriately and the facility has
conducted the emergency drills as required. All plumbing is working as required.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
